Package org.dyn4j.dynamics.joint

Sub package of the Dynamics package handling joints.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AngleJoint
    Represents a angle joint.
    DistanceJoint
    Represents a fixed length distance joint.
    FrictionJoint
    Represents a friction joint.
    Joint
    Represents constrained motion between two Bodys.
    JointEdge
    Represents a link from one Body to another over a Joint.
    LineJoint Deprecated
    As of version 3.0.0 replaced with WheelJoint
    MotorJoint
    Represents a motor joint.
    MouseJoint
    Represents a joint attached to a body and the mouse.
    PrismaticJoint
    Represents a prismatic joint.
    PulleyJoint
    Represents a pulley between two Bodys.
    RevoluteJoint
    Represents a pivot joint.
    RopeJoint
    Represents a maximum/minimum length distance joint.
    WeldJoint
    Represents a weld joint.
    WheelJoint
    Represents a revolute joint attached to a prismatic joint typically used to simulate a vehicle's wheel and suspension.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    Joint.LimitState
    Enumeration for the limit states a joint can have.

Package org.dyn4j.dynamics.joint Description

Sub package of the Dynamics package handling joints.

Joints are solved using an iterative constraint based approach in the same manner as contacts.

All joints, with exception of the MouseJoint joint a pair of Bodys.

Current listing of joints:

  • AngleJoint for constraining the rotation of two bodies
  • DistanceJoint for fixed length distance and spring/damper
  • FrictionJoint for applying friction, air resistance, joint friction, etc
  • MotorJoint for character control
  • MouseJoint specifically to connect a distance joint with spring/damper to one body
  • PrismaticJoint for only allowing relative linear motion along an axis with or without a motor and limits
  • PulleyJoint for creating a pulley with or without block-and- tackle
  • RevoluteJoint for only allowing relative rotation with or without a motor
  • RopeJoint for min/max distance
  • WeldJoint for connecting two bodies together completely
  • WheelJoint for connecting two bodies in a frame-wheel type configuration with linear spring/damper and angular motor
Since:
1.0.0
Version:
3.1.1
Author:
William Bittle
